tourBios.intlVics: (8): 2005 Platinum Classic [SAf]. 2008 Vodacom Origins Tour [SAf]. 2009 Telkom PGA Championship [SAf], Samsung Royal Swazi Open [SAf], Telkom PGA Pro-Am [SAf], Vodacom Business - Sishen [SAf]. 2010 Nashua Golf Challenge [SAf], Telkom PGA Pro-Am [SAf].
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Winner of the 2000 South African Amateur.
tourBios.otherInfo:
2007: Played his rookie season on the PGA TOUR. Went on to make four of 21 cuts on TOUR, with a T33 at the Wyndham Championship his best effort...Made seven starts on the Web.com Tour, with a runner-up finish at the Melwood Prince George's County Open his best outing, finishing just one stroke behind tournament winner Paul Claxton. 

2006: Enjoyed a remarkable PGA TOUR Qualifying Tournament. Entered final round at even-par and tied for 75th, not having broken 70 all week. Posted low final round, an 8-under 64, to finish T29 and earn PGA TOUR card in first trip to the finals...In seven Web.com Tour starts, turned in one top-10, a T10 at the Price Cutter Charity Championship.

2005: Won the Sunshine Tour's Platinum Classic

tourBios.intlVics: (9): 2005 Platinum Classic [SAf]. 2008 Vodacom Origins of Golf [SAf]. 2009 Telkom PGA Championship [SAf], Samsung Royal Swazi Sun Open [SAf], Telkom PGA Pro-Am [SAf]. 2010 Vodacom Business Origins of Golf [SAf], Nashua Golf Challenge [SAf], Telkom PGA Pro-Am [SAf], SAA Pro-Am Invitational [SAf].
tourBios.carHigh:
2012: Had three European Tour top-10s during the season. Was T7 at the Open de Andalucia de Golf in March (shot a final-round 66)...Was T10 at the BMW Italian Open in mid-September, shooting weekend rounds of 68-64...Added a second T10, this time at the Barclays Singapore Open, in mid-November...In his four Southern Africa Tour starts, was top-10 in all four. Was solo fourth at the Africa Open. Shot an opening 71 then came back with a 65-67-66 finish...The next week, at the Joburg Open, he improved his performance, finishing T3, with four rounds in the 60s...In late-February, was T8 at the Telkom PGA Champonship, thanks to a final-round 67. In late-July, at the 54-hole Vodacom Origins-De Zalze, he was T9. 

2011: Turned in his first two European Tour top-10s, with a fourth-place showing at the Africa Open in January. Came back in April in Morocco to lose in a playoff to David Horsey at the Hassan II Trophy...Enjoyed a sixth-place finish on the Sunshine Tour at the Dimension Data Pro-Am. 

2010: Won four times on the Sunshine Tour in his native South Africa, picking up titles at the Vodacom Business Origins of Golf, Nashua Golf Challenge, the Telkom PGA Pro-Am (for the second time) and the SAA Pro-Am Invitational. 

2009: Won multiple titles for the first time in his career, winning three times, at the Telkom PGA Championship, the Samsung Royal Swazi Sun Open and the Telkom PGA Pro-Am. 2008: Earned his second Sunshine Tour title when he captured the Vodacom Origins of Golf. Also had second-place performances at the BMG Classsic and the Telkom PGA Pro-Am, the second consecutive year he was runner-up there. 

2007: The PGA TOUR rookie had a remarkable 2006 Qualifying Tournament. Entered final round at even par and tied for 75th, not having broken 70 all week. Posted low final round, an 8-under-par 64, to finish T29 and earn TOUR card in first trip to the finals. Played in 21 events but only made four cuts, with his best showing a T33 at the Wyndham Championship in Greensboro. Also played seven Nationwide Tour tournaments, coming close to victory at the Melwood Prince George's County Open. After opening with a 1-under 71, played the next 54 holes in 16-under to T2, one stroke behind winner Paul Claxton at the Maryland event. 

2006: Played seven events on the Web.com Tour, with one top-10, a T10 at the Price Cutter Charity Championship....Recorded his best European Tour finish, with a T8 at the Dunhill Championship. 

2005: Won his first Sunshine Tour event by grabbing the Platinum Classic. Amateur: Winner of the 2000 South African Amateur.
tourBios.personal: Is an avid water sportsman, participating in water skiing, swimming and surfing.
tourBios.priorYearSeason: Opened with a 2-under 71 at the Africa Open, then followed with rounds of 65-67-66 at East London GC in the European Tour's season-opener but could only muster a solo-fourth finish, four strokes behind winner Louis Oosthuizen...Came back a week later at the Joburg Open with rounds of 67-69-69-68 at Royal Johannesburg and Kensington GC to T3.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the Web.com Tour was T2nd in 2007 at the Melwood Prince George's County Open.
